 e-faith: do u intervene as a judge? That is, do you independently accept/reject arguments presented for reasons outside those presented in round.
 
 Example: I argue "X." You don't think X is a very strong argument, but my opponent never responds to it. Do you accept X as a voter or not?

 e-faith: do u intervene as a judge? That is, do you independently accept/reject arguments presented for reasons outside those presented in round.
 
 Example: I argue "X." You don't think X is a very strong argument, but my opponent never responds to it. Do you accept X as a voter or not?

 
 I will not argue at all. If your oponent does not respond to the argument I will weigh it against the other arguments according to the weight given it by the person in question. 
 
 I would accept X as a voter but only with the weight that it was given during the round. In other words, you argue x in your first post, your opponent doesn't respond, but you drop it till the final post, I consider it to have next to no weight because you dropped it too. However, if you carry it through and say that it outweighs other consderations because of blah blah blah, then I look seriously at it.
